page.title: 11FARMING AROUND PROBUS 2
page.content: FARMING AROUND PROBUS contd. The other 2 examples are both dairy farms,one of 240 & the other of 400 acres.The smaller one has a herd of about 120 Fresian cows producing about 2,500 litres a day.The larger farm has 2 herds of about 140 cows in each. Neither farm has been greatly affected by the new milk quotas partly because they can reduce the yield by reducing the special concentrates previously given.The milk is collected every day by tankers from the St. Ivel Dairy in Camborne.Both farms grow corn & grass for silage,which has replaced hay as being less reliant on the weather.The smaller farm has 2 working owners & employ 2 men & the larger one is owned by a company & employ 5 men.
